P1Q10: The provided human error modes were helpful with including specific ‘If When Then’ descriptions of rule encodings. The arrows were fairly easy to use and implement. The download diagram png and clear all buttons were convenient.
P1Q11: The various human error mode and schemata boxes were not size adjustable and did not conform to the amount of text input. Text could not be edited afterward initial input. The general human error scenarios were limited without an option to add custom general scenarios.

P1Q10: The recent ability to add multiple arrows, the ability to quickly export pngs, and the support it gives you to correctly construct human error boxes are very helpful
P1Q11: No ability to scale boxes or at least have it scale as you add more text, meaning that boxes quickly have writing overflow. There is also not enough room to put multiple boxes in events, as sometimes occurred in class examples. Also, no ability to delete single element

P1Q10:
Drag and drop function and not having to write as much as error modes are already
written
P1Q11: Arrows are a little hard to grab and text box for resulting defect and location is too small

P1Q10: I like the clear all button. The tutorial is nice.
P1Q11: I found it a bit annoying you couldn’t rotate arrows. I also would have liked the to be able to delete things rather than throw them off the screen. Also, if you hit cancel it still creates a blank box for whatever error mode you clicked on.

P1Q10: I like that for some error modes the program automatically fills out the general scenario
P1Q11: The fact that you can’t change the text of the bubbles after they spawn

P1Q10: Making diagrams like this is a pain, and using this system is a lot easier to make these specfic types of diagrams then using any other tool. The built-in element formats are really helpful and save a lot of time when making EPS diagrams
P1Q11: Can’t delete elements;  Can’t change element text after creating them; Element text sometimes escapes the element’s boundaries;  Missing many error modes

P1Q10: Thought, it was di?icult for figuring out the way to use it, however after learning the tool, it is much faster than manually drawing. ; The tutorial section gave some glimpse of how to operate the tool and its system
P1Q11:
No enough details in the tutorial, perhaps some hovering e?ect on the buttons or some icons would guide user for better understanding of the tool. ; There is no delete or undo feature, so in the beginning multiple tries and errors were made. ; Later figured out that to delete something we just need to hide in behind the canvas. An 
early instruction on this would be extremely helpful.

P1Q10: Simple straightforward tool that doesn’t have a huge learning curve to it.
P1Q11: No option to delete graphical elements which is annoying when paired with not being able to preview what a created graphical element will look like after creation.

P1Q10: Easy to learn how to use
P1Q11: Inconsistent, Doesn't always work

P1Q10: It Is easy to use and it gives clean and concise diagram in less time.
P1Q11: Clear all, I didn’t like the option clear all, there should be an option of undo or go back or delete single entity instead of clear all.

P1Q10: Graph blocks were easy to use ; Easy to drag and move graph blocks
P1Q11: Connections were hard to move and resize ; Limited number of connections

P1Q10: Structured error Analysis; Cognitive mapping; Error prevention
P1Q11: Complexity ; Open to interpretatio

P1Q10: The system is incredibly easy to use, has simple features and does not clutter the screen.
P1Q11: The most glaring negative aspect is that not all of the HEM’s are present, the images are exported at very low quality as well.

P1Q10: Drag and drop components are very nice to have.
P1Q11: I want to be able to delete components rather than only being able to clear the entire diagram.

P1Q10: Much easier for creating human error modes; Since the tool is targeted for EPS, it is clearer what is needed to create an EPS diagram than if I was hand making them; Overall saved me time
P1Q11:
Cannot delete shapes/lines; Cannot modify text;  Cannot change shapes size, making it so you cannot fit everything you want appropriate in 
a diagram

P1Q10: How it has HEMS premade likepost completion error and stuff
P1Q11: I think may be not having an option to undo things or delete specific selected item

P1Q10: It makes it a lot quicker and easier to analyze human errors compared to doing everything by hand. The built-in structures save a lot of time by already having a description of the error.
P1Q11: Only some of the potentially relevant human error modes are included in the system. Additionally, there are some issues with the implementation of the software. This arrow structure often comes apart when I am trying to adjust the source of an arrow;  Additionally, the Strong-but-now-wrong structure displays the Rule X box as Rule A

P1Q10: I liked that arrows could be moved on each end
P1Q11:
Not being able to edit text from boxes after they were created (and not being able to
highlight the text to copy and paste them with changes either)

Components were simple and easy to locate. Moving components and connecting them

P1Q10: I like that it does a lot of the tedious work for me like drawing the shapes and showing the if-when-then model for each error-prone scenario
P1Q11: Not being able to modify elements after they’ve been created

P1Q10: Easy to use, simple UI
P1Q11: It was kind of annoying that you have to click exactly on the item to move it, even if you are only just a few pixels off ; Cancelling the prompt still adds the blank graphic to the screen ; You cannot delete a singular item without clearing the entire page

P1Q10: Makes it much easier to draw diagrams. Would always use this over pen and paper.
P1Q11: It can be difficult to drag things where you want them to go. It also needs a delete button, it is very frustrating that you can’t delete individual parts.
column13: It can be difficult to drag things where you want them to go. It also needs a delete button, it is very frustrating that you can’t delete individual parts.

P1Q10: The system was easy to use after watching the live demo. The features are clear.
P1Q11: The system was a little inconvenient to use because any mistakes had to be moved off screen rather than being able to just undo actions.
column13: The system was a little inconvenient to use because any mistakes had to be moved off screen rather than being able to just undo actions.

P1Q10: It likely would save time when creating EPSs for many defects/scenarios;  It has potential if the kinks are worked out
P1Q11: No delete function;  Can’t actually cancel a module after clicking on it;  Connectors with multiple arrows can separate; Doesn’t support some HEMs; Fixed size canvas
column13: No delete function;  Can’t actually cancel a module after clicking on it;  Connectors with multiple arrows can separate; Doesn’t support some HEMs; Fixed size canvas

P1Q10:
The EPS tool made drawing Causal Mechanism Graphs quick and clean.I really liked
that I could drag-and-drop nodes, label them clearly, and connect arrows without
worrying about messy layouts.It saved a lot of time compared to manual drawing, and I
could easily edit or move items when I changed my mind.The interface felt simple and
consistent, so I didn’t need any help to figure it out.Overall, it helped me focus on
thinking about the causes of errors instead of fighting with formatting
P1Q11:
Sometimes the layout jumped around when I added new nodes, and I had to reposition
them manually.There’s no grid-snap or alignment feature, so keeping things neat took
extra effort.It also doesn’t let you duplicate a node or edge easily, which would save
time when several CMGs have similar structures.Finally, the export image quality could
be a bit higher for presentations.These are minor issues, but fixing them would make
the tool even smoother to use.
column13:
Sometimes the layout jumped around when I added new nodes, and I had to reposition
them manually.There’s no grid-snap or alignment feature, so keeping things neat took
extra effort.It also doesn’t let you duplicate a node or edge easily, which would save
time when several CMGs have similar structures.Finally, the export image quality could
be a bit higher for presentations.These are minor issues, but fixing them would make
the tool even smoother to use.

P1Q10: It was certainly much faster to complete the diagram with it that without it, and it did provide some structural help in setting it up.
P1Q11: If you messed up you have to delete everything and restart, you can’t delete individual components, there is no help or examples on how the various diagrams should look. Also the clicking and dragging is very finicky.
column13: If you messed up you have to delete everything and restart, you can’t delete individual components, there is no help or examples on how the various diagrams should look. Also the clicking and dragging is very finicky.

P1Q10: Ease of creating Causal Mechanism Graphs; Popups direct user well; Easy to use tool
P1Q11: User interface is lacking;  Prompts are a bit hard to understand sometimes; If you click an HEM, then click cancel, it still draws to the canvas
column13: User interface is lacking;  Prompts are a bit hard to understand sometimes; If you click an HEM, then click cancel, it still draws to the canvas

P1Q10: Works quickly
P1Q11: Difficult to understand, lacks basic useful functionality, tutorial unhelpful, user interface not appealing.It took me at least ten minutes when I could have drawn this by hand in a few minutes. Very frustrating.

P1Q10: When available, the templates were fairly easy to use. ; The dragging for the arrows were intuitive.

P1Q10: It was very easy to connect different parts of the diagram.
P1Q11: Defect/location form you coudlnt write very much in them without the formatting overlapping with each other; Strong-but-now-Wrong rule has two rule A’s and no Rule X; Not being able to delete stuff was annoying I wish that was a feature (even though you can  just drag what you arent using off screen)

P1Q10: It makes something difficult and time-consuming fairly easy

P1Q11: The smaller elements were confusing, and I’m still unsure what they’re referring to for  specific elements. Also the UI seems pretty rough/rudimentary

P1Q10: Obviously I would say the ability to create/construct a CMG graph so quickly and easily is a major plus. Not having to draw or construct any of the shapes myself is greatly time saving.
P1Q11: I think it would be very helpful to include some sort of delete function, maybe just including backspace key functionality and cntrl-z. I would also say adding more control over the shapes, like being able to shrink them would be great.
column13: I think it would be very helpful to include some sort of delete function, maybe just including backspace key functionality and cntrl-z. I would also say adding more control over the shapes, like being able to shrink them would be great.

P1Q10: Easy to use; Straightforward; Very helpful in creating the charts; Has several helpful/useful features; The tutorial was extremely helpful
P1Q11: No way to edit text in the components; No way to resize the components; To delete components, you have to drag it off the canvas. It would be nice to have a delete button
column13: No way to edit text in the components; No way to resize the components; To delete components, you have to drag it off the canvas. It would be nice to have a delete button

P1Q10: Auto-filling the general forms is very convenient and well executed
P1Q11: There is no delete a single item button (that I saw) ; You can’t edit the text of the objects after they are created

P1Q10: The prompts that pop up to autofill the Current Scenario symbol.; The ability to export to PNG.
P1Q11: Unable to delete single elements or undo changes.; Unable to “send back” or “bring forward” elements of the diagram.; Text boxes don’t grow to auto-fit text.
column13: Unable to delete single elements or undo changes.; Unable to “send back” or “bring forward” elements of the diagram.; Text boxes don’t grow to auto-fit text.

P1Q10: Definitely made it faster to make these diagrams, and a bit easier. UI overall was fairly easy to work with and straight-forward. Downloading the images worked fine.
P1Q11: Lack of an undo button, or a way to edit text after editing it, makes it really hard to walk back a small issue like a typo. Boxes can't be sized 'down' from what I found, making some diagrams unnecessasrily clunky.
column13: Lack of an undo button, or a way to edit text after editing it, makes it really hard to walk back a small issue like a typo. Boxes can't be sized 'down' from what I found, making some diagrams unnecessasrily clunky.

P1Q10: The use of templates for human error modes is helpful.
P1Q11: The system doesn’t include all human error modes. There isn’t a way to undo/redo or to  delete individual objects. The space is too small for complex graphs, with no apparent way  to increase the size. Objects don’t resize for text to fit inside them. Connectors don’t snap to  objects. It could benefit from grouping the human error modes into categories.
column13: The system doesn’t include all human error modes. There isn’t a way to undo/redo or to  delete individual objects. The space is too small for complex graphs, with no apparent way  to increase the size. Objects don’t resize for text to fit inside them. Connectors don’t snap to  objects. It could benefit from grouping the human error modes into categories.

P1Q10: The scenario definitions are included. The tutorial includes an example screenshot. Filling out the popups to define the scenario helps to better understand the root cause of the error. It saves a lot of time once you get the hang of it.
P1Q11: Creating an accurate graph without experience is difficult, and an example graph is necessary to get it right. I found myself using a separate text document to write out the text I would enter in the popups. This made creating the graphs very quick. The graph resolution and font size is a little too low for enlarging to fill a slide for presentation, it ends up blurry.
column13: Creating an accurate graph without experience is difficult, and an example graph is necessary to get it right. I found myself using a separate text document to write out the text I would enter in the popups. This made creating the graphs very quick. The graph resolution and font size is a little too low for enlarging to fill a slide for presentation, it ends up blurry.

P1Q10: It's very nice to not have to create the graph from scratch, and being able to move elements around is convenient.
P1Q11: The bottom rows and how to use them is not explained anywhere, so you have to learn by trial and error, which is not ideal. It would also be nice to edit the wording once a HEM is placed or delete single elements without having to clear all.
column13: The bottom rows and how to use them is not explained anywhere, so you have to learn by trial and error, which is not ideal. It would also be nice to edit the wording once a HEM is placed or delete single elements without having to clear all.

P1Q10: Constructing the graphs themselves is made easy and when you have

P1Q10: The Arrows were nice to use, and overall style was nice.

There was no delete a single box function that I could find, which led to some frustrating
moments.

There was no delete a single box function that I could find, which led to some frustrating

P1Q10: It is much easier to use the system than to draw everything by hand.
P1Q11: The UI is hard to use. There is no way to edit existing elements. I don’t know what a button will do until I click it, so I click it first to see what it does than click it again to get the result I want. The design is not responsive to screen size (it requires scrolling on my laptop).
column13: The UI is hard to use. There is no way to edit existing elements. I don’t know what a button will do until I click it, so I click it first to see what it does than click it again to get the result I want. The design is not responsive to screen size (it requires scrolling on my laptop).

P1Q10: Given that you understand the background material (Human Error Root Cause Analysis), the tool is understandable and the features make sense. ;  Saves time compared to writing everything by hand if you are okay with it not being perfect.; I like the green theme colours. Gives it a nice personal feel and reminds me of websites from the 90s to early 2000s.
P1Q11:
It was not clear how I might be able to delete one object from the page instead of clearing all. I ended up taking more time even than drawing by hand because of the small manual edits I had to do to make sure it was accurate and readable.; Cannot resize boxes, which means my text went past the borders of the box and had to be fixed manually. I was not able to have the ends of lines/arrows snap to the objects.; Can’t ctrl z to undo.
A allows me to move the arrows off the trigger circle; “Location of task” box uses the wrong box type (dotted line instead of straight line);  Cannot save as a json or svg which means I cannot save my work and edit later
